intro: Ochlandra rheedei var. sivagiriana, commonly known as the Sivagiri ochlandra, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It is a shrub that can grow up to 1.5 meters tall, with a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
